VXLIB_fastCornersDetect_i8u

Function Documentation

VXLIB_STATUS VXLIB_fastCornersDetect_i8u ( const uint8_t  src[],
const VXLIB_bufParams2D_t *  src_addr,
uint32_t  corners[],
uint32_t  corners_capacity,
uint8_t  strength_thresh,
uint32_t *  num_corners,
uint8_t  scratch[],
uint32_t  scratch_size 
)

Description:
Detects the corners in an 8 bit image using the FAST9 algorithm.
Method:
FAST9 algorithm.
Parameters:
[in] src[] Pointer to array containing input image (UQ8.0)
[in] src_addr[] Pointer to structure containing dimensional information of src
[out] corners[] Pointer to array containing corner keypoint list (UQ32.0)
[in] corners_capacity Number of keypoints allocated in the corners buffer.
[in] strength_thresh Threshold on difference between intensity of the central pixel and pixels on the Bresenham's circle of radius 3.
[out] *num_corners Total number of corners found in the image.
[in] scratch[] Pointer to scratch buffer of at least 64 bytes (UQ8.0)
[in] scratch_size Size of scratch buffer in number of bytes (for parameter checking)
Assumptions:
  • I/O buffer pointers are assumed to be not aliased.
  • The minimum image width and height are both 7.
  • Corners can not be detected in the 3 pixels that make up the image border.
  • Each 32-bit word in corners[] array is composed of 2 16-bit half words representing x and y coordinates, such that corners[i] = (y(i) << 16) | x(i);
  • The scratch buffer should be 8 byte aligned.
  • The scratch buffer should be at least 64 bytes
Performance Considerations:
  • For best performance, the following parameter settings are recommended:
    • Set the width as a multiple of 16, minus 6.

VXLIB_STATUS VXLIB_fastCornersDetect_i8u_checkParams ( const uint8_t  src[],
const VXLIB_bufParams2D_t *  src_addr,
const uint32_t  corners[],
uint32_t  corners_capacity,
uint8_t  strength_thresh,
const uint32_t *  num_corners,
const uint8_t  scratch[],
uint32_t  scratch_size 
)

Description:
Checks the parameters for programming errors for the VXLIB_fastCornersDetect_i8u function.
Method:
The following checks are made:
  • There shall be no NULL pointers
  • The strides of the image shall be equal to or greater than the x dimension
  • The scratch_size shall be >= 64
Parameters:
[in] src[] Pointer to array containing input image (UQ8.0)
[in] src_addr[] Pointer to structure containing dimensional information of src
[out] corners[] Pointer to array containing corner keypoint list (UQ32.0)
[in] corners_capacity Number of keypoints allocated in the corners buffer.
[in] strength_thresh Threshold on difference between intensity of the central pixel and pixels on the Bresenham's circle of radius 3.
[out] *num_corners Total number of corners found in the image.
[in] scratch[] Pointer to scratch buffer (UQ8.0)
[in] scratch_size Size of scratch buffer in number of bytes (for parameter checking)
